alert.note: Alert for Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Grand Valley; Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide; Upper Gunnison River Valley (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 5:29PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...SNOW SQUALL... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 529 PM MDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from 16 miles west of Delta to 11 miles north of Aneth and moving southeast at 35 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Montrose, Delta, Cortez, Olathe, Dolores, Dove Creek, Nucla, Naturita, Norwood, Sawpit, Slick Rock, Placerville, Redvale, Vancorum, Towaoc, Mesa Verde Natl Park, Uravan, Cahone, Egnar and Hovenweep National Monument. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 550 in Colorado between mile markers 118 and 130. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 55 and 102. U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 27 and 69. U.S. Highway 491 in Utah between mile markers 16 and 17. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 23 and 54. Colorado 62 between mile markers 1 and 11. Colorado 90 between mile markers 20 and 89. Colorado 92 near mile marker 1. Colorado 141 between mile markers 1 and 78. Colorado 145 between mile markers 1 and 33, and between mile markers 78 and 116. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
